Several people, including a journalist, sustained injuries as well as several vehicles were vandalized, while the former DP and other leaders were whisked to safety. The immediate former Limuru member of parliament (Jubilee-Azimio) and the area member of county assembly (UDA, Kenya Kwanza) were abducted by suspected police officers from the director of criminal investigations during the incident. The motive for the abduction is unknown/not reported. The former MP was held and later abandoned near the Southern bypass, while the MCA was abandoned at Kinale forest. The police refuted the claims.

notes: On 18 October 2024, four-armed government security officers (in plain clothes, spoke Swahili and driving a white jeep, likely police officers- the agency tasked with maintain law and order) intercepted and abducted a Briton and seven Turkish refugees (teachers) (described as victims of political victimization), within the Kileleshwa neighborhoods of Nairobi - Dagoretti North (Dagoretti North, Nairobi). The victims were blindfolded and taken around for around eight hours. The group left the Briton and three Turks in an unknown location, while the other four Turks (described as members of the Hizmet, other sources mention Gulen movement) were repatriated to Turkey at the request of the Turkish government.

notes: On 14 September 2024, suspected Al Shabaab, wounded drivers when they ambushed and set ablaze two lorries transporting khat(miraa), in Mahadathe (other sources mention Shebtakurrow) near Kutulo (Tarbaj, Wajir). Other sources mention a lorry driver and his co-driver transporting khat-miraa, and were being tailgated by a vehicle carrying four National Police Reservists-NPRs, before the NPRs alighted and fled into a nearby thicket, leading the militants to torch the NPRs car as the lorry driver and his co-driver were directed to drive back; while other sources mention that the militants ambushed a truck driver, ransacked his truck and ordered him to produce the NPRs escorting the vehicle. The NPRs had already jumped off the truck, before setting ablaze two other lorries that had been stopped earlier and ordering the truck driver to drive back to El Wak.

notes: On 28 August 2024, suspected Orma militia, armed with arrows and machetes, waylaid and attacked Degodia herders at a water point, in El Niqa (other sources mention Elnigha) near Bangale (Bura, Tana River) in an act of revenge. This was due to the arrest of two members of their community who were suspected to have sexually assaulted a woman (other sources mention a 16-year-old girl) from the Degodia community (coded separately). Five people were killed, including a five-year-old boy, and several others escaped with injuries during the incident.

source: Daily Nation (Kenya); Kenya Broadcasting Corporation; NTV (Kenya); Star (Kenya)

notes: On 25 June 2024, about six thousand residents, mainly youth, demonstrated for hours in Githurai neighborhood of Nairobi - Roysambu (Roysambu, Nairobi) against the government's proposed tax measures in the finance bill 2024 and against the suspected grabbing of a football field. Demonstrators pelted police with stones, barricaded the road with an electricity pole, cut off a police Land Cruiser from the convoy before setting it ablaze, and vandalized two other police pick-up trucks, with some attempting to overrun Githurai Mwiki police station. Police (with one source mentioning residents were unsure if it was riot police or military) used batons, teargas canisters, and live bullets to disperse the group. At least three people were killed (the opposition claimed 157 were killed), and more than 15 (other sources mention 18) demonstrators (including a 16-year-old girl) and 20 police officers sustained injuries during the incident.

notes: On 25 June 2024, between 3,000 to 4,000 residents, mainly youth organized under the 'Occupy Parliament' banner, joined by human rights activists, demonstrated for hours in the Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Starehe, Nairobi) against the government's proposed tax measures in the finance bill 2024. The demonstration turned violent as demonstrators lit bonfires, set a police lorry ablaze, looted and set ablaze businesses, including Sunbeam commercial building and the Uganda High Commission building, punctured the water tank of a police water cannon, torched unknown number of vehicles at the supreme court, burnt the governor's office, before storming into parliament, where they vandalized property of unknown value and set a section of the building ablaze in demonstration. Police lobbed teargas canisters, used water cannons, clubs, and live bullets to disperse the group. At least 120 demonstrators sustained bullet wounds, at least 13 were killed (Kenya National Commission on Human Rights reported 19 killed), including three traders in the Sunbeam building, while an unknown number of demonstrators were arrested and tortured (extent of injuries unknown/not reported).

source: BBC News; Citizen (Kenya); Daily Nation (Kenya); HRW; K24; Kenya Broadcasting Corporation; Kenya Standard; Kenyans.co; KTN News (Kenya); NTV (Kenya)

source: Citizen (Kenya); CNN; Daily Nation (Kenya); Ghetto Radio; K24; Kenya Standard; Kenyans.co; NTV (Kenya); Opera News (Kenya); Star (Kenya)
notes: On 20 June 2024, hundreds of residents, mainly youth organized under the 'Occupy Parliament,' banner, joined by human rights activists, demonstrated for hours in the Nairobi Central Business District (CBD) (Starehe, Nairobi) against the government's proposed tax measures in the finance bill 2024. The demonstration turned violent as demonstrators pelted vehicles parked inside Parliament precincts with stones, lit bonfires and looted shops in demonstration. Police lobbed teargas canisters, used water cannons, clubs, and live bullets to disperse the group, and arrested 20 (other sources mention 100) people. Over 200 demonstrators sustained injuries (other sources mention nine, others 15), including an international journalist. Two people succumbed to the injuries. A public service vehicle windscreen was destroyed by a tear gas canister.

source: Citizen (Kenya); CNN; Daily Nation (Kenya); Ghetto Radio; K24; Kenya Standard; Kenyans.co; NTV (Kenya); Opera News (Kenya); Star (Kenya)

notes: On 17 May 2024, supporters, mainly traders, of Thika Member of Parliament (MP) and Kamenu ward Members of County Assembly (MCA) (both UDA, Kenya Kwanza), clashed with each other, some pelting stones and engaging in running battles, with one of the MP's accompanying the Thika MP allegedly opening fire at Kiganjo area of Thika (Thika Town, Kiambu) over the construction of a market, with both camps claiming credit for the project. Gatundu South member of parliament was later arrested on 31 May, in connection with the shooting.

assoc_actor_1: Azimio la Umoja One Kenya Coalition Party; ODM: Orange Democratic Movement

notes: On 3 May 2024, supporters of the Migori governor and Uriri Member of Parliament (both ODM, Azimio) clashed with each other, with some pelting stones and using other crude weapons, during a burial ceremony in Rapogi (Uriri, Migori) following a longstanding feud. The burial program was momentarily halted as police fired gunshots and lobbed teargas to disperse the groups. Two people, including a nine-year-old boy, sustained injuries and unknown value of property destroyed during the incident. The party later summoned all elected and nominated ODM leaders that were present at the burial, to explain their role during the incident.

On 3 May 2024, civil society representatives, joined by members of the Bunge la Mwananchi lobby group, gathered and sang solidarity songs, while waving placards in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) in support of the ongoing doctors' strike. The group demanded the government to address the doctors' grievances.

Around 3 May 2024 (as reported), a mob threatened to lynch two women, before sprinkling the two with sewage water in the Githurai 45 neighborhood of Nairobi - Roysambu (Roysambu, Nairobi) for stealing 90000 shillings from a mobile money agent.

notes: On 2 May 2024, overnight, unknown people (coded as an unidentified armed group) attacked and killed a private security personnel (unarmed), before chopping off his right hand, disfigured the face and dumped the body near his house in Rawinji area of Oyugis town (Kasipul, Homa Bay). It is unclear whether the killing is linked to the nature of his work of providing security to politicians. A driver attached to the National Government Constituency Development Fund (NG-CDF) in Kasipul Constituency was later arrested in connection with the murder.

notes: On 4 March 2024, hundreds of health workers marched in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against delays in the posting of medical interns as well as delays in the absorption of universal healthcare workers, among other grievances. Led by KMPDU officials, the group demanded the cabinet secretary for health address their grievances and that the Government act on the recent assault on the KMPDU secretary general during a demonstration (coded separately).

On 4 March 2024, 250 security guards protested outside a company in Del Monte (Gatanga, Muranga) against alleged unfair dismissal. The group demanded the local political leaders and the government help them get justice.

On 4 March 2024, workers at a construction site attacked county inspectorate officers using sticks and stones in Ayany neighborhoods of Nairobi - Kibra (Kibra, Nairobi) during an inspection drive. Six suspects were later arrested by the police, and the construction site closed. One officer sustained injuries and was taken to hospital, as the rest managed to escape, while their vehicle was damaged during the incident.

notes: On 3 March 2024, a mob, mainly Nyumba Kumi Initiative members (vigilante group), beat up and injured a 15-year-old student in the Musingu area of Shirumba village (Ikolomani, Kakamega) for allegedly visiting his girlfriend. On 3 March 2024, for the third day, 2000 members of the Maa pastoral community (likely Maasai ethnic group, as Maasai are the majority in Kajiado county) barricaded the Taveta- Loitokitok road with tree branches and rocks, with some invading farms and damaging property at the Rombo group ranch, in Rombo (Loitokitok, Kajiado) in a demonstration against the subdivision of the ranch on the border of Kajiado and Taita Taveta counties among its 6000 members. The group demanded that local leaders from both counties help address the land division issue and the release of a human rights defender arrested by the police.

On 3 March 2024, rival groups clashed with each other in Keroka town (Nyaribari Masaba, Kisii) over a border dispute between Kisii and Nyamira counties. The clash took place after police officers and Nyamira County enforcement officers raided the town and demolished business structures belonging to traders. Calm was restored after police lobbed teargas to disperse the groups. No details on the injuries.

Around 4 January 2024 (as reported), residents protested in Kapsabet town (Chesumei, Nandi) against increased cases insecurity, following the recent electronic shop break-ins. The group demanded the county commissioner to address the matter.

Around 4 January 2024 (as reported), over 700 families of squatters protested at the Chepchoina settlement scheme phase three (Endebess, Trans Nzoia) against alleged move by ministry of lands officials to collude with unknown individuals (described as cartels) to evict them from their current land. The group demanded the President to help address the matter.
On 4 January 2024, health workers at Mediheal hospital gathered at the hospital's Nairobi branch (Starehe, Nairobi) against delayed pay.

source: Daily Nation (Kenya); Kenya Broadcasting Corporation; KTN News (Kenya)
notes: On 4 January 2024, traders (other sources mention loaders) marched at Limuru clothes market (Limuru, Kiambu) against increased cases of Donkey theft to illegal slaughters. The group demanded the closure of slaughter houses.

source: Citizen (Kenya); Kenya Broadcasting Corporation; Kenya Standard; Kenyans.co; KTN News (Kenya)
notes: On 4 January 2024, boda boda taxi operators, small-scale traders and human rights defenders under the Linda Jamii banner marched in Malindi town (Malindi, Kilifi) against the alleged move by the government to benefit from the mama mboga and boda boda rider brand during the campaign period. The group demanded compensation of up to Ksh465 billion from the government as well as politicians to stop using the mama mboga and boda boda rider brand.

On 3 January 2024, suspected Al Shabaab shot and killed a 13-year-old boy, who was among four other passengers traveling to Hagadera from Hamey at Omar Mathahey (coded as Hagadera, Fafi, Garissa). The other passengers escaped unhurt.

notes: On 3 January 2024, residents ejected earthmovers constructing roads in the area by pelting stones, while others lit bonfires, broke into songs and chants in solidarity in the Gikumari area of Ruiru (Ruiru, Kiambu) in demonstration against an alleged plot by high-ranking individuals in government to forcefully evict them and develop high-rise buildings. The group demanded their political leaders to help address the matter.

Around 3 January 2024 (as reported), traders protested in the Sunton neighborhoods of Nairobi - Kasarani (Kasarani, Nairobi) against alleged harassment by officers from the Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS). The group demanded the agency to look into the matter.

Around 3 January 2024 (as reported), residents stormed Namang'ofulo high school (Sirisia, Bungoma) before attacking unknown number of workers allied to a businessman and setting a blaze two tractors and a lorry, following alleged move by the businessman to cut the school trees without proper public participation. The workers managed to escape with minor injuries.

On 3 January 2024, four suspected police officers allegedly abducted a Tuk Tuk taxi operator, before bundling him into a silver Probox in Nyali (Nyali, Mombasa) over unclear reasons. The victim is yet to be found.

Around 2 January 2024 (as reported), unknown assailants (coded as Unidentified Ethnic Militia) shot and injured three people (two of the victims were tending to their maize plantation, while the third one was a milk vendor) along Angata Barrikoi -Ntimaru road at Keturo (Transmara West, Narok). It is unclear whether the attack happened in the context of ethnically motivated land clashes that have recently been witnessed in the area.

On 2 January 2024, residents protested at Kihara Level 4 Hospital (Kiambaa, Kiambu) against lack of healthcare services. The group demanded the authorities to equip the hospital as well as avail emergency services for women.
On 2 January 2024, residents protested in Kadenge (Alego Usonga, Siaya) against environmental degradation by the Rai-owned Company Lake Agro. The group demanded the company to stop the degradation.

notes: On 2 January 2024, residents and traders barricaded the Makutano -Embu highway with burning tires at Difathas (Kirinyaga East, Kirinyaga) in demonstration against increased insecurity, following the recent move by the police to release one of the suspects under unclear circumstances. Led by Murinduko Ward Member of County Assembly (MCA) (TSP; Kenya Kwanza) the group demanded the local police officers transferred.

On 2 January 2024, youth recently arrested over suspicion of being members of the outlawed Mungiki Sect protested inside cells at the Nyeri Divisional police headquarters (Nyeri Central, Nyeri) against their arrest and detention. The group demanded for freedom and solidarity.

On 2 January 2024, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Trans Nzoia County gathered in an unspecified location (coded to the county headquarters as Kitale, Saboti, Trans Nzoia) against the move by the government not to honor their employment agreement. The group demanded the Teachers Service Commission (TSC) to address the matter as well as the government to consider domiciling the JSS to secondary schools.

On 2 January 2024, health workers at Mediheal hospital protested in Nakuru (Nakuru North, Nakuru) against delayed pay. The group demanded their employer to address their grievances as well as the government to help address the matter.
Around 1 January 2024 (beginning of month), a faction of Luo council of elders was attacked at Ofafa Memorial Hall in Kisumu city (Kisumu Central, Kisumu). No details on the injuries.
